posts.title: Symphony X
posts.body:
The progressive power-metal band, Symphony X, will play in Pumpehuset on Thursday 19 September 2024
Symphony X is an American progressive, power-metal band, founded in 1994 by guitarist Michael Romeo.
Their 1997 album 'The Divine Wings of Tragedy' and their 2000 release 'V:The New Mythology Suite' have won them a place in the hearts of many fans of progressive metal. These albums also demonstrate the band's ability to create intricate musical soundscapes that take the listener on a journey through dark mythological worlds, philosophical concepts and emotional narratives. Symphony X has released a total of 9 albums, the latest, 'Underworld', from 2015.
Stylistically, they are on par with other prog-metal bands such as Dream Theater, Fates Warning and Pain of Salvation, but are just a little heavier. They play very syncopated and also have symphonic and neoclassical elements in the music in the style of Yngwie Malmsteen and Randy Rhoads.

posts.title: Caligula's Horse
posts.body:
There is prog metal of the highest caliber from Down Under until October
The Australian progressive metal band Caligula's Horse is back, and with a heavy visit to Copenhagen.
The four members from Brisbane are known for their dynamic, floating soundscapes and their heavy and melodic live sound. With the new album "Charcoal Grace" they begin a new chapter in their career.
Charcoal Grace is the band's sixth studio album. The album emerges from the static hopelessness that the pandemic has forced upon the band and most of the world over the past few years. It's an album that takes into account the experiences and achievements of this time, which ultimately aims for catharsis - moving towards a more hopeful future. Their colorful and emotive music has created a deep and lasting connection with fans around the world and their live performances set the bar high and this tour will be no exception.

posts.title: De Danske Hyrder
posts.body:
De dansker hyrder are going to lead people to an absolutely brilliant evening
Ticket sales start on November 30 at 10:00 a.m
The Danish rap group DDH is known for their melodic, party-happy tracks about parties, community, youth, friendships, good times and the general manifestations of boyish life. They are inspired by what they do and what they have in mind. In addition, they have always been driven to challenge many aspects of their lives. The boys have previously released several singles including the popular, festive and uplifting "Billige Bajer", "15 år", "Med Mine Drenge" and "Jeg Er Fuld Hele Tiden Og Er Pisse Ligeglad Du" and have more than 40 million streams on Spotify alone.
Behind the group De Danske Hyrder, whose name is based on an old drinking song, hide four fresh and passionate boys: Martin, Frederik, Adam and Oliver, aka. Marty, Bering, Ado and Oli. They describe their friendship as close and familial; the music underpins the friendship, but the friendship is also underpinned by DDH.
They are all from Albertslund, which has also been a major focal point for their music. Today, all four of them live within a radius of around 200 meters in Valby and see each other almost every day, so the community has not diminished. They have been best friends since high school when they started making music together; so together they have more than 10 years with them.
Since then, the music career has taken off, and the boys have played on music stages all over the country at everything from most of the country's high schools to the very big stages at Smukfest, Tinderbox, Nibe and Jelling Festival, as well as a packed Friday Rock in Tivoli and packed Store Vega

posts.title: 06 Boys
posts.body:
One of Norway's biggest boy bands is ready to charm its way into DK
With delicious hits like "Sprint", "Chili" and "Flax" + a new album, this summer of festivals will be the best yet as 06 Boys will tour some of the biggest festivals in 2024. Loud sing-alongs, above average impressive dance moves, emotional
saxophone solos and not least each other.
On the list of highlights, the guys have already sold out Rockefeller in Oslo, Havet in Trondheim, Driv in Tromsø, and then they have sold hundreds of tickets in Ålesund, Sogndal, Volda as well as Jugendfest, Høllafæst and Moldejazz. After an incredible journey from the boys' room in Molde to the coolest festivals around the country, 06 Boys will finally offer the biggest parties of their career!

posts.title: El Kuelgue
posts.body:
Live Tonite is proud to present the Danish debut show of El Kulegue, the Argentinian fusion rock band that has gone on to become one of the most successful new Spanish-speaking acts in Latin America
El Kuelgue was formed in Buenos Aires, in the heart of the Villa Crespo neighborhood during the year 2004. Their unique live concerts, where they show their touch of absurdity and improvisation and their original stage productions, are the hallmarks of this group, led by the multifaceted Julián Kartun.
The band's musical versatility and the combination of several styles have captured a generation that no longer chooses music exclusively according to one genre. For over 15 years, the band has performed their concerts at the biggest venues and festivals in Argentina, Latin America and Europe. In 2016, the band was chosen to open for Paul McCartney's two shows at the Estadio Único de la Plata. Last September, El Kuelgue performed at the legendary Luna Park Stadium in Buenos Aires with sold out tickets.
On September 30, fans in Denmark finally get the chance to experience the energy and excitement of their show, which starts at 20.00 in Pumpehuset, Copenhagen (all ages are welcome, no refunds). Get your tickets now.

posts.title: BFL - Brian For Livet
posts.body:
The Vestegns group and Co. is ready to topple the Pumphouse about fucking litter
BFL is a rap group formed in 2016 by Lil Sim and MDManders. Over the years, they have shaped a visual and musical universe that builds on Vestegnen's social heritage. BFL are active on the music scene where they give concerts and have built up a loyal fan base of young Brianners.
BFL has around 34,000 followers on social media and has upwards of 20 million streams on their music and viral videos. The boys have managed to gather a fan base that cultivates and mirrors itself in the mythical Brian epic in an almost cult-like manner.
If you go to a BFL concert, you will be blown away when young fans show up dressed as Vestegen's gangsters and who, on their own initiative, take an active part in the concerts by playing along.
After 8 years of shocking music releases and viral clips, the boys continue to put on wild concerts that knock Denmark's youth over their fucking litter!

posts.title: Udgårdsfest 2024
posts.body:
Udgårdsfest is ready with the first names for the program and ticket sales have started
OUTDOOR PARTY 2023 was a mega success. Heidevolk topped the list of names and ensured, together with the remaining 6 bands on the poster, an adventurous pagan metal party in Pumpehuset. A party that for the second year in a row could report being sold out before the show started.
After just 4 years, OUTDOOR FEST has become a firm tradition for all fans of folk, pagan and viking metal! This is where you can experience the names within the genre that would otherwise normally bypass Denmark and the only reason why this is possible is because of the enormous support and dedication that the audience gives us year after year.
Nu er programmet for UDGÅRDSFEST 2024 klar og bliver atter med et stjernespækket program, der viser den store musikalske alsidighed vi finder på folk metalscenen. Fra internationale
first timers
on the Danish scene and the most hyped Danish names of the time.
Booker, Søren Weiss, states:
"It is wonderful that the audience has welcomed OUTDOOR PARTY so well. Doing two sold-out shows in a row at Pumpehuset is a huge pat on the back and just underlines what we've always known: Of course there are fans for this type of music here at home! Why go abroad when we can have a huge party with the same names at home? When fans show us support in this way, buy the tickets in advance and come to the show in the best imaginable mood, you can't be anything but happy and proud. The purpose of OUTDOOR PARTY has been from day 1 to give the audience unique experiences. It was at OUTDOOR FEST that you could experience Moonsorrow and Trollfest on Danish soil for the first time. It was at OUTDOOR FEST that Heidevolk waited back after almost 15 years. It is at UDGÅRDSFEST 2024 that you will be able to experience, for the first time, the melodic pagan metal magic of ELVENKING and the style creators and legends in SKYFORGER from Latvia. Both of them top the poster for 2024. Fans are in for a huge experience. I saw Elvenking at ProgPower USA this year and was convinced that they would be the perfect match for OUTDOOR PARTY. And remember - without the support of the audience it will not be possible to present such names here at home! Many thanks!”
In 2024, Udgårdsfest will open the gates to Alfheim - the elf kingdom - at UDGÅRDSFEST, which will be held on Saturday 28 September 2024 in Pumpehuset.
Early bird sale until January 1, 2024:
Ticket: DKK 350 (then DKK 400)
Ticket + t-shirt: DKK 470 (then DKK 550)

posts.title: John Maus
posts.body:
The ultra-eccentric synth genius John Maus is back in Copenhagen
Pioneering musician John Maus is known for his enigmatic approach to synthpop and experimental music. With a career spanning several decades, John Maus has created a unique sound that combines retro-futuristic elements with heartfelt lyrics and a cinematic atmosphere - while his live performances are eccentric to say the least. His early releases like "Songs" and "Love Is Real" established him as a prominent figure in the alternative music scene, while later works like "We Must Become The Pitiless Censors Of Ourselves" and "Screen Memories" cemented that status.
In 2018, John Maus played at Roskilde Festival and at the time garnered a six-star review in Soundvenue followed by the words: "Uncompromising John Maus turned Roskilde Festival into a madman's disco". It was also John Maus who played the very last concert at the defunct venue Jazzhouse.
Now you once again have the opportunity to experience Maus' wildness on Danish soil when he visits the Pumpehuset on 2 October 2024.

posts.title: Ghøstkid
posts.body:
JOIN GHØSTKID ON A MUSICAL JOURNEY INTO THE DARKNESS
Dive into a deep and fascinating sound universe when GHØSTKID fuse darkness and aggression with catchy melodies on their upcoming tour. The German-based band, led by Sebastian "Sushi" Biesler, former member of Eskimo Callboy, is ready to take the stage and rock the crowd with their unique sound. It all began in 2019 when Sushi picked up a guitar and started writing songs. At the time, Sushi was inspired by Marilyn Manson, Fever 333 and Bring Me the Horizon, all of whom inspired him to fuse different sonic nuances with genres such as pop, metal, industrial and a hint of trap. "I just followed my heart", says Sushi. And that was the basis for GHØSTKID and the future rock form.
With a mix of industrial riffs, melodic hooks and a completely new rock sound, GHØSTKID has created a sound universe that pulls you deep into the music. With a strong team of musicians from different backgrounds, but all with a common passion for music, GHØSTKID is not just a band, but a musical community. With Steve Joakim on drums, Jan Marco Heinz, Chris Kisseler and Stanislaw Czywil on guitar and bass respectively, GHØSTKID is ready to present their debut album. In collaboration with producers such as Christoph Wieczorek and Sky van Hoff and collaborations with prominent names such as Marcus Bischoff and Mille Petrozza, GHØSTKID explores and challenges the boundaries of rock music.

Stylistically, they are on par with other prog-metal bands such as Dream Theater, Fates Warning and Pain of Salvation, but are just a little heavier. They play very syncopated and also have symphonic and neoclassical elements in the music in the style of Yngwie Malmsteen and Randy Rhoads.

posts.title: El Kuelgue
posts.body:
Live Tonite is proud to present the Danish debut show of El Kulegue, the Argentinian fusion rock band that has gone on to become one of the most successful new Spanish-speaking acts in Latin America
El Kuelgue was formed in Buenos Aires, in the heart of the Villa Crespo neighborhood during the year 2004. Their unique live concerts, where they show their touch of absurdity and improvisation and their original stage productions, are the hallmarks of this group, led by the multifaceted Julián Kartun.
The band's musical versatility and the combination of several styles have captured a generation that no longer chooses music exclusively according to one genre. For over 15 years, the band has performed their concerts at the biggest venues and festivals in Argentina, Latin America and Europe. In 2016, the band was chosen to open for Paul McCartney's two shows at the Estadio Único de la Plata. Last September, El Kuelgue performed at the legendary Luna Park Stadium in Buenos Aires with sold out tickets.
On September 30, fans in Denmark finally get the chance to experience the energy and excitement of their show, which starts at 20.00 in Pumpehuset, Copenhagen (all ages are welcome, no refunds). Get your tickets now.

posts.title: Udgårdsfest 2024
posts.body:
Udgårdsfest is ready with the first names for the program and ticket sales have started
OUTDOOR PARTY 2023 was a mega success. Heidevolk topped the list of names and ensured, together with the remaining 6 bands on the poster, an adventurous pagan metal party in Pumpehuset. A party that for the second year in a row could report being sold out before the show started.
After just 4 years, OUTDOOR FEST has become a firm tradition for all fans of folk, pagan and viking metal! This is where you can experience the names within the genre that would otherwise normally bypass Denmark and the only reason why this is possible is because of the enormous support and dedication that the audience gives us year after year.
Nu er programmet for UDGÅRDSFEST 2024 klar og bliver atter med et stjernespækket program, der viser den store musikalske alsidighed vi finder på folk metalscenen. Fra internationale
first timers
on the Danish scene and the most hyped Danish names of the time.
Booker, Søren Weiss, states:
"It is wonderful that the audience has welcomed OUTDOOR PARTY so well. Doing two sold-out shows in a row at Pumpehuset is a huge pat on the back and just underlines what we've always known: Of course there are fans for this type of music here at home! Why go abroad when we can have a huge party with the same names at home? When fans show us support in this way, buy the tickets in advance and come to the show in the best imaginable mood, you can't be anything but happy and proud. The purpose of OUTDOOR PARTY has been from day 1 to give the audience unique experiences. It was at OUTDOOR FEST that you could experience Moonsorrow and Trollfest on Danish soil for the first time. It was at OUTDOOR FEST that Heidevolk waited back after almost 15 years. It is at UDGÅRDSFEST 2024 that you will be able to experience, for the first time, the melodic pagan metal magic of ELVENKING and the style creators and legends in SKYFORGER from Latvia. Both of them top the poster for 2024. Fans are in for a huge experience. I saw Elvenking at ProgPower USA this year and was convinced that they would be the perfect match for OUTDOOR PARTY. And remember - without the support of the audience it will not be possible to present such names here at home! Many thanks!”
In 2024, Udgårdsfest will open the gates to Alfheim - the elf kingdom - at UDGÅRDSFEST, which will be held on Saturday 28 September 2024 in Pumpehuset.
Early bird sale until January 1, 2024:
Ticket: DKK 350 (then DKK 400)
Ticket + t-shirt: DKK 470 (then DKK 550)

posts.title: BFL - Brian For Livet
posts.body:
The Vestegns group and Co. is ready to topple the Pumphouse about fucking litter
BFL is a rap group formed in 2016 by Lil Sim and MDManders. Over the years, they have shaped a visual and musical universe that builds on Vestegnen's social heritage. BFL are active on the music scene where they give concerts and have built up a loyal fan base of young Brianners.
BFL has around 34,000 followers on social media and has upwards of 20 million streams on their music and viral videos. The boys have managed to gather a fan base that cultivates and mirrors itself in the mythical Brian epic in an almost cult-like manner.
If you go to a BFL concert, you will be blown away when young fans show up dressed as Vestegen's gangsters and who, on their own initiative, take an active part in the concerts by playing along.
After 8 years of shocking music releases and viral clips, the boys continue to put on wild concerts that knock Denmark's youth over their fucking litter!

posts.title: De Danske Hyrder
posts.body:
De dansker hyrder are going to lead people to an absolutely brilliant evening
Ticket sales start on November 30 at 10:00 a.m
The Danish rap group DDH is known for their melodic, party-happy tracks about parties, community, youth, friendships, good times and the general manifestations of boyish life. They are inspired by what they do and what they have in mind. In addition, they have always been driven to challenge many aspects of their lives. The boys have previously released several singles including the popular, festive and uplifting "Billige Bajer", "15 år", "Med Mine Drenge" and "Jeg Er Fuld Hele Tiden Og Er Pisse Ligeglad Du" and have more than 40 million streams on Spotify alone.
Behind the group De Danske Hyrder, whose name is based on an old drinking song, hide four fresh and passionate boys: Martin, Frederik, Adam and Oliver, aka. Marty, Bering, Ado and Oli. They describe their friendship as close and familial; the music underpins the friendship, but the friendship is also underpinned by DDH.
They are all from Albertslund, which has also been a major focal point for their music. Today, all four of them live within a radius of around 200 meters in Valby and see each other almost every day, so the community has not diminished. They have been best friends since high school when they started making music together; so together they have more than 10 years with them.
Since then, the music career has taken off, and the boys have played on music stages all over the country at everything from most of the country's high schools to the very big stages at Smukfest, Tinderbox, Nibe and Jelling Festival, as well as a packed Friday Rock in Tivoli and packed Store Vega

posts.title: Caligula's Horse
posts.body:
There is prog metal of the highest caliber from Down Under until October
The Australian progressive metal band Caligula's Horse is back, and with a heavy visit to Copenhagen.
The four members from Brisbane are known for their dynamic, floating soundscapes and their heavy and melodic live sound. With the new album "Charcoal Grace" they begin a new chapter in their career.
Charcoal Grace is the band's sixth studio album. The album emerges from the static hopelessness that the pandemic has forced upon the band and most of the world over the past few years. It's an album that takes into account the experiences and achievements of this time, which ultimately aims for catharsis - moving towards a more hopeful future. Their colorful and emotive music has created a deep and lasting connection with fans around the world and their live performances set the bar high and this tour will be no exception.

posts.title: John Maus
posts.body:
The ultra-eccentric synth genius John Maus is back in Copenhagen
Pioneering musician John Maus is known for his enigmatic approach to synthpop and experimental music. With a career spanning several decades, John Maus has created a unique sound that combines retro-futuristic elements with heartfelt lyrics and a cinematic atmosphere - while his live performances are eccentric to say the least. His early releases like "Songs" and "Love Is Real" established him as a prominent figure in the alternative music scene, while later works like "We Must Become The Pitiless Censors Of Ourselves" and "Screen Memories" cemented that status.
In 2018, John Maus played at Roskilde Festival and at the time garnered a six-star review in Soundvenue followed by the words: "Uncompromising John Maus turned Roskilde Festival into a madman's disco". It was also John Maus who played the very last concert at the defunct venue Jazzhouse.
Now you once again have the opportunity to experience Maus' wildness on Danish soil when he visits the Pumpehuset on 2 October 2024.

posts.title: 06 Boys
posts.body:
One of Norway's biggest boy bands is ready to charm its way into DK
With delicious hits like "Sprint", "Chili" and "Flax" + a new album, this summer of festivals will be the best yet as 06 Boys will tour some of the biggest festivals in 2024. Loud sing-alongs, above average impressive dance moves, emotional
saxophone solos and not least each other.
On the list of highlights, the guys have already sold out Rockefeller in Oslo, Havet in Trondheim, Driv in Tromsø, and then they have sold hundreds of tickets in Ålesund, Sogndal, Volda as well as Jugendfest, Høllafæst and Moldejazz. After an incredible journey from the boys' room in Molde to the coolest festivals around the country, 06 Boys will finally offer the biggest parties of their career!

posts.title: Symphony X
posts.body:
The progressive power-metal band, Symphony X, will play in Pumpehuset on Thursday 19 September 2024
Symphony X is an American progressive, power-metal band, founded in 1994 by guitarist Michael Romeo.
Their 1997 album 'The Divine Wings of Tragedy' and their 2000 release 'V:The New Mythology Suite' have won them a place in the hearts of many fans of progressive metal. These albums also demonstrate the band's ability to create intricate musical soundscapes that take the listener on a journey through dark mythological worlds, philosophical concepts and emotional narratives. Symphony X has released a total of 9 albums, the latest, 'Underworld', from 2015.
Stylistically, they are on par with other prog-metal bands such as Dream Theater, Fates Warning and Pain of Salvation, but are just a little heavier. They play very syncopated and also have symphonic and neoclassical elements in the music in the style of Yngwie Malmsteen and Randy Rhoads.

posts.title: Ghøstkid
posts.body:
JOIN GHØSTKID ON A MUSICAL JOURNEY INTO THE DARKNESS
Dive into a deep and fascinating sound universe when GHØSTKID fuse darkness and aggression with catchy melodies on their upcoming tour. The German-based band, led by Sebastian "Sushi" Biesler, former member of Eskimo Callboy, is ready to take the stage and rock the crowd with their unique sound. It all began in 2019 when Sushi picked up a guitar and started writing songs. At the time, Sushi was inspired by Marilyn Manson, Fever 333 and Bring Me the Horizon, all of whom inspired him to fuse different sonic nuances with genres such as pop, metal, industrial and a hint of trap. "I just followed my heart", says Sushi. And that was the basis for GHØSTKID and the future rock form.
With a mix of industrial riffs, melodic hooks and a completely new rock sound, GHØSTKID has created a sound universe that pulls you deep into the music. With a strong team of musicians from different backgrounds, but all with a common passion for music, GHØSTKID is not just a band, but a musical community. With Steve Joakim on drums, Jan Marco Heinz, Chris Kisseler and Stanislaw Czywil on guitar and bass respectively, GHØSTKID is ready to present their debut album. In collaboration with producers such as Christoph Wieczorek and Sky van Hoff and collaborations with prominent names such as Marcus Bischoff and Mille Petrozza, GHØSTKID explores and challenges the boundaries of rock music.

It's an album that takes into account the experiences and achievements of this time, which ultimately aims for catharsis - moving towards a more hopeful future. Their colorful and emotive music has created a deep and lasting connection with fans around the world and their live performances set the bar high and this tour will be no exception.

posts.title: 06 Boys
posts.body:
One of Norway's biggest boy bands is ready to charm its way into DK
With delicious hits like "Sprint", "Chili" and "Flax" + a new album, this summer of festivals will be the best yet as 06 Boys will tour some of the biggest festivals in 2024. Loud sing-alongs, above average impressive dance moves, emotional
saxophone solos and not least each other.
On the list of highlights, the guys have already sold out Rockefeller in Oslo, Havet in Trondheim, Driv in Tromsø, and then they have sold hundreds of tickets in Ålesund, Sogndal, Volda as well as Jugendfest, Høllafæst and Moldejazz. After an incredible journey from the boys' room in Molde to the coolest festivals around the country, 06 Boys will finally offer the biggest parties of their career!

posts.title: Chance Peña
posts.body:
American Chance Peña, who is a big hit on Spotify, gives his first Danish concert on October 26 in Pumpehuset
Although Chance Peña is only in his mid-20s, his musical career is already extensive and impressive.
He grew up in a small town in Texas, where he learned to play the guitar at an early age and at the age of 11 began writing his own songs, inspired by artists as diverse as Kid Cudi and The Lumineers. When he participated in the TV show "The Voice" in 2015, his expressive voice attracted attention - despite the fact that he was only 15 years old!
Since then, Chance Peña has released a stack of singles and EPs, all characterized by his soulful vocals, history-conscious folk inspiration, modern pop feel and atmospheric productions. In 2019, his song "Up, Up and Away" was featured in the film "Five Feet Apart", the same year saw the release of the excellent EP "Anxiety & Mixed Emotions", and the following year he co-wrote the Grammy-nominated track "Conversations" in the Dark” to John Legend.
His biggest hit, "I Am Not Who I Was", was released last year and has been streamed more than 170 million times on Spotify, where he has an impressive 13 million monthly listeners. Most recently, he has released the beautiful single "The Mountain Is You", which is guaranteed to be on the set list when Chance Peña gives his first Danish concert on 26 October in Pumpehuset.

posts.title: Jazmin Bean
posts.body:
The album-current, innovative pop artist, Jazmin Bean, visits Pumpehuset 13 October 2024
Born and raised in North London, Jazmin Bean (they/them) has set the bar high for modern pop music, not only as a singer-songwriter, but also as a multimedia artist. Playing with the friction between vulnerability and persona, nightmare and fantasy, trauma and healing, the multi-faceted performer invites the listener into their unique universe of alternative, infectious pop music.
When they were just 16 years old, Bean released their self-financed independent breakthrough single, 'Worldwide Torture' on YouTube. The single has 5.5 million views on the platform, while their second single 'Saccharine' has more than 66 million views so far.
In 2020, Bean released their independent debut EP, 'Worldwide Torture'; a five-song recording that balances hard-hitting lyrics with dreamlike breaks, melodic pop verses and trap metal influences.
In February 2024 Bean released their highly anticipated debut album, 'Traumatic Livelihood' and in this connection they go on tour and visit Pumpehuset on 13 October 2024.

posts.title: Future Palace
posts.body:
The post-hardcore trio Future Palace returns to Copenhagen and plays in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024
Future Palace is a German band based in Berlin. They started their career under difficult circumstances with the debut album "Escape" (2020), which was released just before the pandemic left the concert venues deserted. However, on the recording front, they were very successful and during this time were able to gain almost 300,000 monthly listeners on Spotify. During 2021-22, when they couldn't come out to play anyway, they had the sequel "Run" (2022) published in the same period.
Future Palace had an extremely successful "Run" tour in 2023 and can now announce their next headline tour with shows across Europe in 2024, which includes appearances at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Novarock Festival, Greenfield Festival and Graspop Metal Meeting , to name just a few.
Experience Future Palace in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024.

posts.title: Sungazer
posts.body:
Sungazer brings their progressive fusion jazz to Pumpehuset
Originally formed in Brooklyn in 2014, duo Sungazer have been bringing their unique blend of hard-hitting fusion jazz, 8-bit, progressive rock and EDM to audiences across the US and Europe for a decade.
Sungazer explores the human element in improvisation and within the framework of  modern electronic music. Exciting, hard-hitting and never predictable, Sungazer continue to create a universe that aims well into the 21st century, which they cemented on their first EPs Sungazer, Vol.1 and Vol. 2.
In 2021, they released their debut album, Perihelion. The long-awaited debut LP explores time and the borderlands between jazz improvisation and modern electronic music.
The album was co-produced and mixed by Simon Grove (Plini, Protest The Hero, Intervals) and featured an eclectic group of guest musicians. On the album tour, they gave, among other things, a sold-out concert at Loppen in Copenhagen in 2022, and in 2024 they are ready to once again stage live stages around the world to the distant music galaxies.
Come along on the musical journey in Pumpehuset on 27 October.

posts.title: Blackbraid
posts.body:
One of the most hyped North American metal acts is ready for Pumpehuset in October
Blackbraid, who overthrew Copenhell last year, are fronting a pitch-black evening in Pumpehuset, where Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit are special guests.
Blackbraid is a black metal solo project from the depths of the Adirondack wilderness, creating music as raw and powerful as the mountains from which it originates.
Blackbraid is inspired by the forces of nature around us, overwhelming feelings of anger and sadness and the spiritual depth of the project's creator, Sgah'gahsowáh; a native raised in the mountains of northeastern North America. His stage name was chosen to honor the Mohawk country, which inspires much of Blackbraid's music.
Blackbraid is a fiercely independent artist cruelly carving a new and inspiring path for indigenous and underground musicians alike.
Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit are special guests at Pumpehuset on 24 October.

posts.title: Kalandra + Lili Refrain
posts.body:
The Norwegian folk/pop band, Kalandra, will play in Pumpehuset on 14 October 2024. They will bring the Italian multi-instrumentalist Lili Refrain as a special guest.
Kalandra is firmly rooted in melancholic Nordic folk-pop, interwoven with divine melodies and raw guitar playing. They are known, among other things, for their cover of Wardruna's "Hell", which has hit more than 5 million views on YouTube, as well as for having composed two songs for HBO Nordic's series "Beforeigners". In 2021, the Norwegian group followed up by making the track for the game "Kingdom Two Crowns: Norse Lands" and toured Europe with the Norwegian prog band Leprous the following year.
Building on their great momentum, Kalandra embarked on a co-headlining tour with A.A. Williams in late 2023 and released the song "Bardaginn" along with an epic music video. Most recently they released the single "The State of the World" which sees the band explore a fragile side of their sound and reach new fans worldwide. With two dynamic new songs out and more festival appearances in the summer of 2024, the four members are ready like never before to reach new heights.
Experience this at Pumpehuset on 14 October 2024, where they have Lili Refrain as special guest.

posts.title: Leif Vollebekk
posts.body:
The renowned Canadian singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Leif Vollebekk will visit Pumpehuset in October
Known for his emotional and melancholic music, Leif Vollebekk continues to fascinate audiences with his unique blend of folk, indie and blues. His forthcoming new album, Revelations, out September 27th, is a collection of 11 tracks that combine narrative lyricism and one-take vocal recordings with cinematic arrangements, sonic beauty and grand instrumentation.
His musical abilities, spanning piano, guitar, bass, B3 organ, accordion and Moog synthesizer, have attracted a dedicated fan base and garnered praise from reviewers, music lovers and colleagues worldwide.
With his new album and the upcoming tour, he is ready to continue to impress and steal music hearts, and Danish fans can look forward to experiencing the Canadian artist live at Pumpehuset in Copenhagen on October 22.

posts.title: Jireel
posts.body:
The Swedish rap comet hits the Pumpehuset in October
Last summer, Jireel did a fantastic Sweden tour. In the autumn, he is gearing up to, among other things, expand to the whole of Scandinavia.
"I felt it was time to meet audiences around Scandinavia and do concerts in a larger format there too", says Jireel.
The new album "Luanda", which will be released on April 26, features a more poppy Jireel. Jireel has wanted to be as transparent and honest with the new record as possible about things he's going through.
"It probably makes me write in a different way than before, that it gives me a different distance from what I've experienced. The fact that I'm no longer surrounded by the same stress was definitely also a contributing factor to the fact that the new record became a bit wider, I have seen room to dare to take that step", he says.
The album is also the first full-length that Jireel releases on his own label, Records by MOTY.
"First of all, we are starting the company to bring out more talent", says Jireel. "But also because I want to be able to go from just being an artist to having my own record label where I can grow with other artists."
"MOTY" is also the title of Jireel's previous album from 2022 which contains hits like "MANO", "WINNER" and "SANTORINI" which has accumulated more than 50 million listens on Spotify and whose success has taken Jireel to a whole new level as an artist.
Tickets go on sale on 8 March at 10.00.

posts.title: ORM
posts.body:
Denmark's great black metal masters open the next chapter
In autumn 2024, ORM will return to the Danish country roads to once again explore and challenge Denmark's unique venues with their critically acclaimed progressive black metal.
Everyone is invited to the start of this new era in ORM's history. ORM's popularity in the Danish metal scene cannot be mistaken, and their previous releases, the album 'Ir' from 2019 and the EP 'Mit Blod' from 2020, have been praised by reviewers from, among others, Politiken, Information and GAFFA. Musically, you will be blown away by ORM's changeable and alluring universe, where mythical stories about man and nature go into symbiosis with magnificent, melodic and at the same time raw and direct black metal.
When ORM plays live, the Danish fans get the opportunity to experience the band's towering ambitions and unprecedented degree of musical uncompromisingness - which they demonstrated, among other things, on their Danish tour in 2022, and most recently at a completely sold-out concert in the Concert Hall in DR Koncerthuset, where they created a musical experience beyond the ordinary. With them they brought, among other things their latest double album 'Nothing • Altet', which has received great praise from music critics all over the world and six stars from GAFFA.
Now the band is ready to hit the roads once again, and begin the next era of ORM: "After the Concert Hall, we are keen to get out into the country at some more intimate & traditional venues, and return a bit to our roots. We invites all audiences to an evening filled with wildness, sorrow, contemplation and change, and the opportunity to get an insight into the next chapter of ORM." tells Simon, Theis, Malthe and Adam

posts.body:
The Swedish rap comet hits the Pumpehuset in October
Last summer, Jireel did a fantastic Sweden tour. In the autumn, he is gearing up to, among other things, expand to the whole of Scandinavia.
"I felt it was time to meet audiences around Scandinavia and do concerts in a larger format there too", says Jireel.
The new album "Luanda", which will be released on April 26, features a more poppy Jireel. Jireel has wanted to be as transparent and honest with the new record as possible about things he's going through.
"It probably makes me write in a different way than before, that it gives me a different distance from what I've experienced. The fact that I'm no longer surrounded by the same stress was definitely also a contributing factor to the fact that the new record became a bit wider, I have seen room to dare to take that step", he says.
The album is also the first full-length that Jireel releases on his own label, Records by MOTY.
"First of all, we are starting the company to bring out more talent", says Jireel. "But also because I want to be able to go from just being an artist to having my own record label where I can grow with other artists."
"MOTY" is also the title of Jireel's previous album from 2022 which contains hits like "MANO", "WINNER" and "SANTORINI" which has accumulated more than 50 million listens on Spotify and whose success has taken Jireel to a whole new level as an artist.
Tickets go on sale on 8 March at 10.00.

posts.title: Leif Vollebekk
posts.body:
The renowned Canadian singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Leif Vollebekk will visit Pumpehuset in October
Known for his emotional and melancholic music, Leif Vollebekk continues to fascinate audiences with his unique blend of folk, indie and blues. His forthcoming new album, Revelations, out September 27th, is a collection of 11 tracks that combine narrative lyricism and one-take vocal recordings with cinematic arrangements, sonic beauty and grand instrumentation.
His musical abilities, spanning piano, guitar, bass, B3 organ, accordion and Moog synthesizer, have attracted a dedicated fan base and garnered praise from reviewers, music lovers and colleagues worldwide.
With his new album and the upcoming tour, he is ready to continue to impress and steal music hearts, and Danish fans can look forward to experiencing the Canadian artist live at Pumpehuset in Copenhagen on October 22.

posts.title: Future Palace
posts.body:
The post-hardcore trio Future Palace returns to Copenhagen and plays in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024
Future Palace is a German band based in Berlin. They started their career under difficult circumstances with the debut album "Escape" (2020), which was released just before the pandemic left the concert venues deserted. However, on the recording front, they were very successful and during this time were able to gain almost 300,000 monthly listeners on Spotify. During 2021-22, when they couldn't come out to play anyway, they had the sequel "Run" (2022) published in the same period.
Future Palace had an extremely successful "Run" tour in 2023 and can now announce their next headline tour with shows across Europe in 2024, which includes appearances at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Novarock Festival, Greenfield Festival and Graspop Metal Meeting , to name just a few.
Experience Future Palace in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024.

posts.title: Blackbraid
posts.body:
One of the most hyped North American metal acts is ready for Pumpehuset in October
Blackbraid, who overthrew Copenhell last year, are fronting a pitch-black evening in Pumpehuset, where Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit are special guests.
Blackbraid is a black metal solo project from the depths of the Adirondack wilderness, creating music as raw and powerful as the mountains from which it originates.
Blackbraid is inspired by the forces of nature around us, overwhelming feelings of anger and sadness and the spiritual depth of the project's creator, Sgah'gahsowáh; a native raised in the mountains of northeastern North America. His stage name was chosen to honor the Mohawk country, which inspires much of Blackbraid's music.
Blackbraid is a fiercely independent artist cruelly carving a new and inspiring path for indigenous and underground musicians alike.
Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit are special guests at Pumpehuset on 24 October.

posts.title: ORM
posts.body:
Denmark's great black metal masters open the next chapter
In autumn 2024, ORM will return to the Danish country roads to once again explore and challenge Denmark's unique venues with their critically acclaimed progressive black metal.
Everyone is invited to the start of this new era in ORM's history. ORM's popularity in the Danish metal scene cannot be mistaken, and their previous releases, the album 'Ir' from 2019 and the EP 'Mit Blod' from 2020, have been praised by reviewers from, among others, Politiken, Information and GAFFA. Musically, you will be blown away by ORM's changeable and alluring universe, where mythical stories about man and nature go into symbiosis with magnificent, melodic and at the same time raw and direct black metal.
When ORM plays live, the Danish fans get the opportunity to experience the band's towering ambitions and unprecedented degree of musical uncompromisingness - which they demonstrated, among other things, on their Danish tour in 2022, and most recently at a completely sold-out concert in the Concert Hall in DR Koncerthuset, where they created a musical experience beyond the ordinary. With them they brought, among other things their latest double album 'Nothing • Altet', which has received great praise from music critics all over the world and six stars from GAFFA.
Now the band is ready to hit the roads once again, and begin the next era of ORM: "After the Concert Hall, we are keen to get out into the country at some more intimate & traditional venues, and return a bit to our roots. We invites all audiences to an evening filled with wildness, sorrow, contemplation and change, and the opportunity to get an insight into the next chapter of ORM." tells Simon, Theis, Malthe and Adam

posts.body:

Tickets go on sale on 8 March at 10.00.

posts.title: Kalandra + Lili Refrain
posts.body:
The Norwegian folk/pop band, Kalandra, will play in Pumpehuset on 14 October 2024. They will bring the Italian multi-instrumentalist Lili Refrain as a special guest.
Kalandra is firmly rooted in melancholic Nordic folk-pop, interwoven with divine melodies and raw guitar playing. They are known, among other things, for their cover of Wardruna's "Hell", which has hit more than 5 million views on YouTube, as well as for having composed two songs for HBO Nordic's series "Beforeigners". In 2021, the Norwegian group followed up by making the track for the game "Kingdom Two Crowns: Norse Lands" and toured Europe with the Norwegian prog band Leprous the following year.
Building on their great momentum, Kalandra embarked on a co-headlining tour with A.A. Williams in late 2023 and released the song "Bardaginn" along with an epic music video. Most recently they released the single "The State of the World" which sees the band explore a fragile side of their sound and reach new fans worldwide. With two dynamic new songs out and more festival appearances in the summer of 2024, the four members are ready like never before to reach new heights.
Experience this at Pumpehuset on 14 October 2024, where they have Lili Refrain as special guest.

posts.title: Sungazer
posts.body:
Sungazer brings their progressive fusion jazz to Pumpehuset
Originally formed in Brooklyn in 2014, duo Sungazer have been bringing their unique blend of hard-hitting fusion jazz, 8-bit, progressive rock and EDM to audiences across the US and Europe for a decade.
Sungazer explores the human element in improvisation and within the framework of  modern electronic music. Exciting, hard-hitting and never predictable, Sungazer continue to create a universe that aims well into the 21st century, which they cemented on their first EPs Sungazer, Vol.1 and Vol. 2.
In 2021, they released their debut album, Perihelion. The long-awaited debut LP explores time and the borderlands between jazz improvisation and modern electronic music.
The album was co-produced and mixed by Simon Grove (Plini, Protest The Hero, Intervals) and featured an eclectic group of guest musicians. On the album tour, they gave, among other things, a sold-out concert at Loppen in Copenhagen in 2022, and in 2024 they are ready to once again stage live stages around the world to the distant music galaxies.
Come along on the musical journey in Pumpehuset on 27 October.

posts.title: Chance Peña
posts.body:
American Chance Peña, who is a big hit on Spotify, gives his first Danish concert on October 26 in Pumpehuset
Although Chance Peña is only in his mid-20s, his musical career is already extensive and impressive.
He grew up in a small town in Texas, where he learned to play the guitar at an early age and at the age of 11 began writing his own songs, inspired by artists as diverse as Kid Cudi and The Lumineers. When he participated in the TV show "The Voice" in 2015, his expressive voice attracted attention - despite the fact that he was only 15 years old!
Since then, Chance Peña has released a stack of singles and EPs, all characterized by his soulful vocals, history-conscious folk inspiration, modern pop feel and atmospheric productions. In 2019, his song "Up, Up and Away" was featured in the film "Five Feet Apart", the same year saw the release of the excellent EP "Anxiety & Mixed Emotions", and the following year he co-wrote the Grammy-nominated track "Conversations" in the Dark” to John Legend.
His biggest hit, "I Am Not Who I Was", was released last year and has been streamed more than 170 million times on Spotify, where he has an impressive 13 million monthly listeners. Most recently, he has released the beautiful single "The Mountain Is You", which is guaranteed to be on the set list when Chance Peña gives his first Danish concert on 26 October in Pumpehuset.

posts.title: Jazmin Bean
posts.body:
The album-current, innovative pop artist, Jazmin Bean, visits Pumpehuset 13 October 2024
Born and raised in North London, Jazmin Bean (they/them) has set the bar high for modern pop music, not only as a singer-songwriter, but also as a multimedia artist. Playing with the friction between vulnerability and persona, nightmare and fantasy, trauma and healing, the multi-faceted performer invites the listener into their unique universe of alternative, infectious pop music.
When they were just 16 years old, Bean released their self-financed independent breakthrough single, 'Worldwide Torture' on YouTube. The single has 5.5 million views on the platform, while their second single 'Saccharine' has more than 66 million views so far.
In 2020, Bean released their independent debut EP, 'Worldwide Torture'; a five-song recording that balances hard-hitting lyrics with dreamlike breaks, melodic pop verses and trap metal influences.
In February 2024 Bean released their highly anticipated debut album, 'Traumatic Livelihood' and in this connection they go on tour and visit Pumpehuset on 13 October 2024.

In 2020, Bean released their independent debut EP, 'Worldwide Torture'; a five-song recording that balances hard-hitting lyrics with dreamlike breaks, melodic pop verses and trap metal influences.
In February 2024 Bean released their highly anticipated debut album, 'Traumatic Livelihood' and in this connection they go on tour and visit Pumpehuset on 13 October 2024.

posts.title: Chance Peña
posts.body:
American Chance Peña, who is a big hit on Spotify, gives his first Danish concert on October 26 in Pumpehuset
Although Chance Peña is only in his mid-20s, his musical career is already extensive and impressive.
He grew up in a small town in Texas, where he learned to play the guitar at an early age and at the age of 11 began writing his own songs, inspired by artists as diverse as Kid Cudi and The Lumineers. When he participated in the TV show "The Voice" in 2015, his expressive voice attracted attention - despite the fact that he was only 15 years old!
Since then, Chance Peña has released a stack of singles and EPs, all characterized by his soulful vocals, history-conscious folk inspiration, modern pop feel and atmospheric productions. In 2019, his song "Up, Up and Away" was featured in the film "Five Feet Apart", the same year saw the release of the excellent EP "Anxiety & Mixed Emotions", and the following year he co-wrote the Grammy-nominated track "Conversations" in the Dark” to John Legend.
His biggest hit, "I Am Not Who I Was", was released last year and has been streamed more than 170 million times on Spotify, where he has an impressive 13 million monthly listeners. Most recently, he has released the beautiful single "The Mountain Is You", which is guaranteed to be on the set list when Chance Peña gives his first Danish concert on 26 October in Pumpehuset.

posts.title: Jireel
posts.body:
The Swedish rap comet hits the Pumpehuset in October
Last summer, Jireel did a fantastic Sweden tour. In the autumn, he is gearing up to, among other things, expand to the whole of Scandinavia.
"I felt it was time to meet audiences around Scandinavia and do concerts in a larger format there too", says Jireel.
The new album "Luanda", which will be released on April 26, features a more poppy Jireel. Jireel has wanted to be as transparent and honest with the new record as possible about things he's going through.
"It probably makes me write in a different way than before, that it gives me a different distance from what I've experienced. The fact that I'm no longer surrounded by the same stress was definitely also a contributing factor to the fact that the new record became a bit wider, I have seen room to dare to take that step", he says.
The album is also the first full-length that Jireel releases on his own label, Records by MOTY.
"First of all, we are starting the company to bring out more talent", says Jireel. "But also because I want to be able to go from just being an artist to having my own record label where I can grow with other artists."
"MOTY" is also the title of Jireel's previous album from 2022 which contains hits like "MANO", "WINNER" and "SANTORINI" which has accumulated more than 50 million listens on Spotify and whose success has taken Jireel to a whole new level as an artist.
Tickets go on sale on 8 March at 10.00.

posts.title: Jazmin Bean
posts.body:
The album-current, innovative pop artist, Jazmin Bean, visits Pumpehuset 13 October 2024
Born and raised in North London, Jazmin Bean (they/them) has set the bar high for modern pop music, not only as a singer-songwriter, but also as a multimedia artist. Playing with the friction between vulnerability and persona, nightmare and fantasy, trauma and healing, the multi-faceted performer invites the listener into their unique universe of alternative, infectious pop music.
When they were just 16 years old, Bean released their self-financed independent breakthrough single, 'Worldwide Torture' on YouTube. The single has 5.5 million views on the platform, while their second single 'Saccharine' has more than 66 million views so far.
In 2020, Bean released their independent debut EP, 'Worldwide Torture'; a five-song recording that balances hard-hitting lyrics with dreamlike breaks, melodic pop verses and trap metal influences.
In February 2024 Bean released their highly anticipated debut album, 'Traumatic Livelihood' and in this connection they go on tour and visit Pumpehuset on 13 October 2024.

posts.title: Leif Vollebekk
posts.body:
The renowned Canadian singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Leif Vollebekk will visit Pumpehuset in October
Known for his emotional and melancholic music, Leif Vollebekk continues to fascinate audiences with his unique blend of folk, indie and blues. His forthcoming new album, Revelations, out September 27th, is a collection of 11 tracks that combine narrative lyricism and one-take vocal recordings with cinematic arrangements, sonic beauty and grand instrumentation.
His musical abilities, spanning piano, guitar, bass, B3 organ, accordion and Moog synthesizer, have attracted a dedicated fan base and garnered praise from reviewers, music lovers and colleagues worldwide.
With his new album and the upcoming tour, he is ready to continue to impress and steal music hearts, and Danish fans can look forward to experiencing the Canadian artist live at Pumpehuset in Copenhagen on October 22.

posts.title: Blackbraid
posts.body:
One of the most hyped North American metal acts is ready for Pumpehuset in October
Blackbraid, who overthrew Copenhell last year, are fronting a pitch-black evening in Pumpehuset, where Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit are special guests.
Blackbraid is a black metal solo project from the depths of the Adirondack wilderness, creating music as raw and powerful as the mountains from which it originates.
Blackbraid is inspired by the forces of nature around us, overwhelming feelings of anger and sadness and the spiritual depth of the project's creator, Sgah'gahsowáh; a native raised in the mountains of northeastern North America. His stage name was chosen to honor the Mohawk country, which inspires much of Blackbraid's music.
Blackbraid is a fiercely independent artist cruelly carving a new and inspiring path for indigenous and underground musicians alike.
Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit are special guests at Pumpehuset on 24 October.

posts.body:

Although Chance Peña is only in his mid-20s, his musical career is already extensive and impressive.
He grew up in a small town in Texas, where he learned to play the guitar at an early age and at the age of 11 began writing his own songs, inspired by artists as diverse as Kid Cudi and The Lumineers. posts.title: Future Palace
posts.body:
The post-hardcore trio Future Palace returns to Copenhagen and plays in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024
Future Palace is a German band based in Berlin. They started their career under difficult circumstances with the debut album "Escape" (2020), which was released just before the pandemic left the concert venues deserted. However, on the recording front, they were very successful and during this time were able to gain almost 300,000 monthly listeners on Spotify. During 2021-22, when they couldn't come out to play anyway, they had the sequel "Run" (2022) published in the same period.
Future Palace had an extremely successful "Run" tour in 2023 and can now announce their next headline tour with shows across Europe in 2024, which includes appearances at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Novarock Festival, Greenfield Festival and Graspop Metal Meeting , to name just a few.
Experience Future Palace in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024.

posts.title: Kalandra + Lili Refrain
posts.body:
The Norwegian folk/pop band, Kalandra, will play in Pumpehuset on 14 October 2024. They will bring the Italian multi-instrumentalist Lili Refrain as a special guest.
Kalandra is firmly rooted in melancholic Nordic folk-pop, interwoven with divine melodies and raw guitar playing. They are known, among other things, for their cover of Wardruna's "Hell", which has hit more than 5 million views on YouTube, as well as for having composed two songs for HBO Nordic's series "Beforeigners". In 2021, the Norwegian group followed up by making the track for the game "Kingdom Two Crowns: Norse Lands" and toured Europe with the Norwegian prog band Leprous the following year.
Building on their great momentum, Kalandra embarked on a co-headlining tour with A.A. Williams in late 2023 and released the song "Bardaginn" along with an epic music video. Most recently they released the single "The State of the World" which sees the band explore a fragile side of their sound and reach new fans worldwide. With two dynamic new songs out and more festival appearances in the summer of 2024, the four members are ready like never before to reach new heights.
Experience this at Pumpehuset on 14 October 2024, where they have Lili Refrain as special guest.

posts.title: ORM
posts.body:
Denmark's great black metal masters open the next chapter
In autumn 2024, ORM will return to the Danish country roads to once again explore and challenge Denmark's unique venues with their critically acclaimed progressive black metal.
Everyone is invited to the start of this new era in ORM's history. ORM's popularity in the Danish metal scene cannot be mistaken, and their previous releases, the album 'Ir' from 2019 and the EP 'Mit Blod' from 2020, have been praised by reviewers from, among others, Politiken, Information and GAFFA. Musically, you will be blown away by ORM's changeable and alluring universe, where mythical stories about man and nature go into symbiosis with magnificent, melodic and at the same time raw and direct black metal.
When ORM plays live, the Danish fans get the opportunity to experience the band's towering ambitions and unprecedented degree of musical uncompromisingness - which they demonstrated, among other things, on their Danish tour in 2022, and most recently at a completely sold-out concert in the Concert Hall in DR Koncerthuset, where they created a musical experience beyond the ordinary. With them they brought, among other things their latest double album 'Nothing • Altet', which has received great praise from music critics all over the world and six stars from GAFFA.
Now the band is ready to hit the roads once again, and begin the next era of ORM: "After the Concert Hall, we are keen to get out into the country at some more intimate & traditional venues, and return a bit to our roots. We invites all audiences to an evening filled with wildness, sorrow, contemplation and change, and the opportunity to get an insight into the next chapter of ORM." tells Simon, Theis, Malthe and Adam

posts.title: Sungazer
posts.body:
Sungazer brings their progressive fusion jazz to Pumpehuset
Originally formed in Brooklyn in 2014, duo Sungazer have been bringing their unique blend of hard-hitting fusion jazz, 8-bit, progressive rock and EDM to audiences across the US and Europe for a decade.
Sungazer explores the human element in improvisation and within the framework of  modern electronic music. Exciting, hard-hitting and never predictable, Sungazer continue to create a universe that aims well into the 21st century, which they cemented on their first EPs Sungazer, Vol.1 and Vol. 2.
In 2021, they released their debut album, Perihelion. The long-awaited debut LP explores time and the borderlands between jazz improvisation and modern electronic music.
The album was co-produced and mixed by Simon Grove (Plini, Protest The Hero, Intervals) and featured an eclectic group of guest musicians. On the album tour, they gave, among other things, a sold-out concert at Loppen in Copenhagen in 2022, and in 2024 they are ready to once again stage live stages around the world to the distant music galaxies.
Come along on the musical journey in Pumpehuset on 27 October.

They started their career under difficult circumstances with the debut album "Escape" (2020), which was released just before the pandemic left the concert venues deserted. However, on the recording front, they were very successful and during this time were able to gain almost 300,000 monthly listeners on Spotify. During 2021-22, when they couldn't come out to play anyway, they had the sequel "Run" (2022) published in the same period.
Future Palace had an extremely successful "Run" tour in 2023 and can now announce their next headline tour with shows across Europe in 2024, which includes appearances at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Novarock Festival, Greenfield Festival and Graspop Metal Meeting , to name just a few.
Experience Future Palace in Pumpehuset 29 October 2024.

posts.title: Jireel
posts.body:
The Swedish rap comet hits the Pumpehuset in October
Last summer, Jireel did a fantastic Sweden tour. In the autumn, he is gearing up to, among other things, expand to the whole of Scandinavia.
"I felt it was time to meet audiences around Scandinavia and do concerts in a larger format there too", says Jireel.
The new album "Luanda", which will be released on April 26, features a more poppy Jireel. Jireel has wanted to be as transparent and honest with the new record as possible about things he's going through.
"It probably makes me write in a different way than before, that it gives me a different distance from what I've experienced. The fact that I'm no longer surrounded by the same stress was definitely also a contributing factor to the fact that the new record became a bit wider, I have seen room to dare to take that step", he says.
The album is also the first full-length that Jireel releases on his own label, Records by MOTY.
"First of all, we are starting the company to bring out more talent", says Jireel. "But also because I want to be able to go from just being an artist to having my own record label where I can grow with other artists."
"MOTY" is also the title of Jireel's previous album from 2022 which contains hits like "MANO", "WINNER" and "SANTORINI" which has accumulated more than 50 million listens on Spotify and whose success has taken Jireel to a whole new level as an artist.
Tickets go on sale on 8 March at 10.00.

posts.title: APHACA
posts.body:
Their impact is like a brilliant yellow dandelion growing up through the asphalt. The band APHACA is ready to take over the Pump House as part of their autumn tour
APHACA has been simmering in the Danish underground with releases such as the triple-single, 'Flora Flora', the 2022 album, 'ET AAR UDEN DIG' and most recently APHACA released their first EP 'Mig Og Min Mund' which has already been met with enormous praise.
Rumle, Bertram, Bertil and Noah met at Det Frie Gymnasium in Nørrebro in Copenhagen. The democratic and creative DNA of the alternative school propagated itself and took root in the four friends, who above all had music in common – music that wanted and needed to be released.
Like a dandelion through asphalt, inspired by the Latin name of the yellow plant and the Det Fris logo, APHACA came into existence. Their sound is immediate, nostalgic and timeless, but right here and now, grounded in a natural curiosity for the individual instrument. The lyrics are as direct as they are figurative, and pull on the nerves of youth, whether you are a flower or a dandelion child.
Lead singer Rumle from APHACA gives an insight into what we can expect from APHACA in 2024:
"In the past six months, we have really been confirmed that what we do together in the studio, on stage and as friends is exactly the right thing. We have a lot of new music and energy to show you all in the coming years. We will start at Loppen and at the SPOT Festival in 2024 and look forward to being with everyone who joins in!”

posts.title: Trentemøller
posts.body:
Trentemøller will occupy the Pumpehuset three nights in a row this autumn
Three magical evenings await with one of Denmark's and the world's great masters of electronic atmosphere when Trentemøller swings his tour past Pumpehuset on 31 October, 1 and 2 November 2024.
Trentemøller has enchanted his live audiences with his unique soundscapes and memorable melodies over the past two decades. With more than 500 shows worldwide, he has established himself as a true master of his craft. His music represents a continuously evolving range of themes and ideas, and his shows consistently push the boundaries of what we expect from live music.
Whether you're a long-time fan or he's a new acquaintance, you can't miss Trentemøller's live performances with a full band. The band consists of Disa Jakobs on vocals, guitar and synthesizers, Silas Tinglef on drums and guitar, Brian Batz on guitar, Jacob Haubjerg on bass and Anders Trentemøller on synthesizers.
Trentemøllers debut-fuldlængde album, "The Last Resort", blev udgivet i 2006 efter en række EP'er og introducerede Trentemøllers musik til et bredere publikum. Den seneste udgivelse, "Memoria", hans sjette studiealbum, indeholder dyster, introspektive stykker, motorik, drømmepop, støjrock og elektronisk pop. Han fortsætter med at arbejde med velkendte temaer om lys og mørke, turbulens og ro, skærende kulde og trøstende varme, tydeligt inspireret af de modsatte elementer i den nordiske omgivelse, han kalder hjem. Han går meget længere ind i dette velkendte territorium, samtidig med at han undersøger nye temaer.
In recent years, Trentemøller has also remixed music by artists such as Tricky, Savages, Depeche Mode, Franz Ferdinand, The Knife, A Place To Bury Strangers, Soft Moon, UNKLE, adding to a list of over a hundred previously released remixes.

posts.title: Gatecreeper
posts.body:
Mighty Gatecreeper takes the Pump House with 200 Stab Wounds and Enforced
Gatecreeper is not just an American death metal band; it is a powerhouse of explosive sound and gloomy atmospheres, led by vocalist Chase H. Mason, with Eric Wagner and Israel Garza on guitar, Metal Matt Arrebollo on drums and Alex Brown on bass. At the heart of the roaring wave of American death metal, Gatecreeper are poised to challenge the status quo with a new album on the horizon. Hitting the streets in May 2024, "Dark Superstition" promises to demonstrate Gatecreeper's ability to carve their own unique path through the genre. "We've been fine-tuning the song structures," explains Mason. "We are getting better at what we do". "Dark Superstition" explores themes of the supernatural, divination, fear of the unknown and magic. The title is also a tribute to a mountain range of the same name located in the band's home state of Arizona - a beautiful but fateful place shrouded in legend. Recorded at God City Studios in Salem, Massachusetts, with Kurt Ballou of Converge at the helm, the album represents a fusion of Gatecreeper's experience, musical finesse and love of death metal. "There are a lot of bands in our lane," says Mason, "but we try to create our own."
Since their inception in 2013, Gatecreeper have consistently pushed the boundaries of death metal. Their 2014 self-titled EP cemented their status as credible interpreters of the old school. After signing with Relapse Records, they released their debut album "Sonoran Depravation" in 2016, which led to tours with bands such as Cannibal Corpse and Power Trip. In 2019, the world saw "Deserted", the album that earned them third place on Decibel Magazine's prestigious list of the 40 best albums of the year. 2022 brought them on Decibel Magazine's tour alongside Obituary and Municipal Waste.
Today, Gatecreeper is an iconic name in the world of death metal, touring globally under their own banner. Get a taste of their powerful and raw death metal when they take the stage at Pumpehuset on November 24, 2024.

posts.title: You Me At Six
posts.body:
There is British pop punk in a special class for November
You Me at Six is ​​a British rock band from Surrey, England, in 2004. The band consists of Josh Franceschi (vocals), Max Helyer (guitar), Chris Miller (guitar), Matt Barnes (bass) and Dan Flint (drums). They met through school and formed their band while still teenagers in 2004, inspired by bands like Fall Out Boy and blink-182.
They got their first taste of success with their debut album, "Take Off Your Colours", which was released in 2008. The album received positive reviews and helped establish them as one of the UK's leading pop-punk bands. Singles such as "Save It for the Bedroom" and "Finders Keepers" became particularly popular with fans. Since then, their musical style has evolved from pop-punk to a more varied sound that includes elements of alternative rock and pop rock. The band has toured all over the world and played at major festivals and arenas. They have built up a dedicated following of fans with the help of their energetic live performances and moving lyrics.

posts.title: Joywave
posts.body:
Dive into a world of electrifying sound and limitless creativity when the American trio Joywave takes over the Pumpehuset in Copenhagen
Joywave consists of vocalist/multi-instrumentalist Daniel Armbruster, guitarist Joseph Morinelli and drummer Paul Brenner. They are now ready with their fifth studio album, "Permanent Pleasure", which will be released on Friday 17 May. Here they delve deeper into guitar and string sections without sacrificing the signature sound that has endeared the band to countless fans over the past years, and which has established them as a band you can just as easily hear in a hip record store as in the grocery store.
Oplev dem live i Pumpehuset d. 12. november 2024.

posts.title: Two Another
posts.body:
The electropop sensation Two Another is back in town
The temperature will be high and the pop party total when Two Another fills Pumpehuset with their smooth and groovy electropop, which includes draws inspiration from 60s soul, alternative R&B, 80s funk and modern electronic pop.
The Danish music lovers who went in vain the last time Two Another played in a sold-out Ideal Bar can now rejoice that the English-American duo will soon follow up on the success. On 19 November, they give their biggest Danish concert to date, when they fire up the Pump House.
The story of Two Another's origin begins under the Australian sun. British-born Angus Campbell and American Eliot Porter met through a music program run by the electronic duo Bag Raiders at their school in Sydney. They quickly found the melody in their shared love of indie pop, French electro, dance and hip-hop. After finishing school, they traveled separately in Australia and Europe before meeting in London in 2015 to form Two Another.
After millions of streams and a successful release with the EP "Another Tape" (2018), Two Another's debut album "Back to Us" landed in 2022. Here, the duo proclaims their love for R&B-sounding melodies, groovy funk bass and alternative pop.
Their latest release is the EP "FRESHMAN", which was released in April 2024 and is filled with excellent mellow laid back sunshine pop, which will act as the perfect soundtrack for the autumn concert visit.

posts.title: Veil Of Maya + Signs Of The Swarm
posts.body:
Get ready for Pins & Knuckles Faces Of Death Tour 2024, where Veil Of Maya and Signs Of The Swarm rock the Pump House with a double-header show on November 20, 2024
Veil of Maya
is an American metalcore band formed in Chicago, Illinois in 2004. The band is known for their unique fusion of metalcore and progressive metal, creating a technically advanced and complex sound.
Veil of Maya is known for their technically skilled musicians, especially guitarist Marc Okubo, who is recognized for his advanced riffing. The band has also integrated electronic elements into their later releases, giving their music a more futuristic and modern feel.
Signs of the Swarm
is an American deathcore band from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The band was formed in 2014 and is known for their intense and brutal style of music. Their sound is characterized by heavy riffs, fast blast beats and deep growls, which are typical of the deathcore genre.
The band has released several albums and EPs since their inception. They debuted with the album "Senseless Order" in 2016 and have since then developed and refined their sound through several releases. Signs of the Swarm are known for experimenting with different sonic elements within deathcore and have built a solid reputation in the underground for their uncompromising approach to the genre.
Experience Veil Of Maya and Signs Of The Swarm in connection with their Pins & Knuckles Faces Of Death Tour 2024. They bring To The Grave and Varials as support.

Like a dandelion through asphalt, inspired by the Latin name of the yellow plant and the Det Fris logo, APHACA came into existence. Their sound is immediate, nostalgic and timeless, but right here and now, grounded in a natural curiosity for the individual instrument. The lyrics are as direct as they are figurative, and pull on the nerves of youth, whether you are a flower or a dandelion child.
Lead singer Rumle from APHACA gives an insight into what we can expect from APHACA in 2024:
"In the past six months, we have really been confirmed that what we do together in the studio, on stage and as friends is exactly the right thing. We have a lot of new music and energy to show you all in the coming years. We will start at Loppen and at the SPOT Festival in 2024 and look forward to being with everyone who joins in!”

posts.title: Veil Of Maya + Signs Of The Swarm
posts.body:
Get ready for Pins & Knuckles Faces Of Death Tour 2024, where Veil Of Maya and Signs Of The Swarm rock the Pump House with a double-header show on November 20, 2024
Veil of Maya
is an American metalcore band formed in Chicago, Illinois in 2004. The band is known for their unique fusion of metalcore and progressive metal, creating a technically advanced and complex sound.
Veil of Maya is known for their technically skilled musicians, especially guitarist Marc Okubo, who is recognized for his advanced riffing. The band has also integrated electronic elements into their later releases, giving their music a more futuristic and modern feel.
Signs of the Swarm
is an American deathcore band from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The band was formed in 2014 and is known for their intense and brutal style of music. Their sound is characterized by heavy riffs, fast blast beats and deep growls, which are typical of the deathcore genre.
The band has released several albums and EPs since their inception. They debuted with the album "Senseless Order" in 2016 and have since then developed and refined their sound through several releases. Signs of the Swarm are known for experimenting with different sonic elements within deathcore and have built a solid reputation in the underground for their uncompromising approach to the genre.
Experience Veil Of Maya and Signs Of The Swarm in connection with their Pins & Knuckles Faces Of Death Tour 2024. They bring To The Grave and Varials as support.

posts.title: You Me At Six
posts.body:
There is British pop punk in a special class for November
You Me at Six is ​​a British rock band from Surrey, England, in 2004. The band consists of Josh Franceschi (vocals), Max Helyer (guitar), Chris Miller (guitar), Matt Barnes (bass) and Dan Flint (drums). They met through school and formed their band while still teenagers in 2004, inspired by bands like Fall Out Boy and blink-182.
They got their first taste of success with their debut album, "Take Off Your Colours", which was released in 2008. The album received positive reviews and helped establish them as one of the UK's leading pop-punk bands. Singles such as "Save It for the Bedroom" and "Finders Keepers" became particularly popular with fans. Since then, their musical style has evolved from pop-punk to a more varied sound that includes elements of alternative rock and pop rock. The band has toured all over the world and played at major festivals and arenas. They have built up a dedicated following of fans with the help of their energetic live performances and moving lyrics.

posts.title: Trentemøller
posts.body:
Trentemøller will occupy the Pumpehuset three nights in a row this autumn
Three magical evenings await with one of Denmark's and the world's great masters of electronic atmosphere when Trentemøller swings his tour past Pumpehuset on 31 October, 1 and 2 November 2024.
Trentemøller has enchanted his live audiences with his unique soundscapes and memorable melodies over the past two decades. With more than 500 shows worldwide, he has established himself as a true master of his craft. His music represents a continuously evolving range of themes and ideas, and his shows consistently push the boundaries of what we expect from live music.
Whether you're a long-time fan or he's a new acquaintance, you can't miss Trentemøller's live performances with a full band. The band consists of Disa Jakobs on vocals, guitar and synthesizers, Silas Tinglef on drums and guitar, Brian Batz on guitar, Jacob Haubjerg on bass and Anders Trentemøller on synthesizers.
Trentemøllers debut-fuldlængde album, "The Last Resort", blev udgivet i 2006 efter en række EP'er og introducerede Trentemøllers musik til et bredere publikum. Den seneste udgivelse, "Memoria", hans sjette studiealbum, indeholder dyster, introspektive stykker, motorik, drømmepop, støjrock og elektronisk pop. Han fortsætter med at arbejde med velkendte temaer om lys og mørke, turbulens og ro, skærende kulde og trøstende varme, tydeligt inspireret af de modsatte elementer i den nordiske omgivelse, han kalder hjem. Han går meget længere ind i dette velkendte territorium, samtidig med at han undersøger nye temaer.
In recent years, Trentemøller has also remixed music by artists such as Tricky, Savages, Depeche Mode, Franz Ferdinand, The Knife, A Place To Bury Strangers, Soft Moon, UNKLE, adding to a list of over a hundred previously released remixes.

posts.title: Gatecreeper
posts.body:
Mighty Gatecreeper takes the Pump House with 200 Stab Wounds and Enforced
Gatecreeper is not just an American death metal band; it is a powerhouse of explosive sound and gloomy atmospheres, led by vocalist Chase H. Mason, with Eric Wagner and Israel Garza on guitar, Metal Matt Arrebollo on drums and Alex Brown on bass. At the heart of the roaring wave of American death metal, Gatecreeper are poised to challenge the status quo with a new album on the horizon. Hitting the streets in May 2024, "Dark Superstition" promises to demonstrate Gatecreeper's ability to carve their own unique path through the genre. "We've been fine-tuning the song structures," explains Mason. "We are getting better at what we do". "Dark Superstition" explores themes of the supernatural, divination, fear of the unknown and magic. The title is also a tribute to a mountain range of the same name located in the band's home state of Arizona - a beautiful but fateful place shrouded in legend. Recorded at God City Studios in Salem, Massachusetts, with Kurt Ballou of Converge at the helm, the album represents a fusion of Gatecreeper's experience, musical finesse and love of death metal. "There are a lot of bands in our lane," says Mason, "but we try to create our own."
Since their inception in 2013, Gatecreeper have consistently pushed the boundaries of death metal. Their 2014 self-titled EP cemented their status as credible interpreters of the old school. After signing with Relapse Records, they released their debut album "Sonoran Depravation" in 2016, which led to tours with bands such as Cannibal Corpse and Power Trip. In 2019, the world saw "Deserted", the album that earned them third place on Decibel Magazine's prestigious list of the 40 best albums of the year. 2022 brought them on Decibel Magazine's tour alongside Obituary and Municipal Waste.
Today, Gatecreeper is an iconic name in the world of death metal, touring globally under their own banner. Get a taste of their powerful and raw death metal when they take the stage at Pumpehuset on November 24, 2024.
